properties.name: action
properties.description:
If set, a synchronous POST call will be fired to the path defined.
The `login` event is also dispatched, so `event.preventDefault()` can be called to prevent the POST call.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description:
If set, disable the "Log in" button and prevent user from submitting login form.
It is re-enabled automatically, when error is set to true, allowing form resubmission
after user makes changes.

properties.name: error
properties.description:
If set, the error message is shown. The message is hidden by default.
When set, it changes the disabled state of the submit button.

properties.name: noForgotPassword
properties.description: Whether to hide the forgot password button. The button is visible by default.

properties.name: i18n
properties.defaultValue: {"form":{"title":"Log in","username":"Username","password":"Password","submit":"Log in","forgotPassword":"Forgot password"},"errorMessage":{"title":"Incorrect username or password","message":"Check that you have entered the correct username and password and try again."}}

properties.name: _preventAutoEnable
properties.description: If set, prevents auto enabling the component when error property is set to true.

attributes.name: action
attributes.description:
If set, a synchronous POST call will be fired to the path defined.
The `login` event is also dispatched, so `event.preventDefault()` can be called to prevent the POST call.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description:
If set, disable the "Log in" button and prevent user from submitting login form.
It is re-enabled automatically, when error is set to true, allowing form resubmission
after user makes changes.

attributes.name: error
attributes.description:
If set, the error message is shown. The message is hidden by default.
When set, it changes the disabled state of the submit button.

attributes.name: no-forgot-password
attributes.description: Whether to hide the forgot password button. The button is visible by default.

attributes.name: i18n

events.name: forgot-password
events.description: Fired when user clicks on the "Forgot password" button.

events.name: login
events.description:
Fired when an user submits the login.
The event contains `username` and `password` values in the `detail` property.

elements.description:
`<vaadin-login-form-wrapper>` is a helper component providing a wrapper for the login form.

See the usage in `<vaadin-login-form>`.

### Styling

The following Shadow DOM parts of the `<vaadin-login-form-wrapper>` are available for styling:

Part name      | Description
---------------|---------------------------------------------------------|
`form`         | Container for the entire component's content
`form-title`   | Title of the login form
`error-message`| Container for error message, contains error-message-title and error-message-description parts. Hidden by default.
`error-message-title`       | Container for error message title
`error-message-description` | Container for error message description
`error-message-description` | Container for error message description
`footer`  | Container additional information text from `i18n` object

See [ThemableMixin â€“ how to apply styles for shadow parts](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-themable-mixin/wiki)

### Component's slots

The following slots are available for being set

Slot name | Description
----------|---------------------------------------------------|
`form`    | Html form placeholder. See the usage in `<vaadin-login-form>`.

See examples of setting the content into slots in the live demos.

elements.description:
`<vaadin-login-form>` is a Web Component providing an easy way to require users
to log in into an application. Note that component has no shadowRoot.

```
<vaadin-login-form></vaadin-login-form>
```

Component has to be accessible from the `document` layer in order to allow password managers to work properly with form values.
Using `<vaadin-login-overlay>` allows to always attach the component to the document body.

### Styling

The component doesn't have a shadowRoot, so the html form and input fields can be styled in an upper layer. To style
`vaadin-login-form-wrapper` check its documentation.

See examples of setting the content into slots in the live demos.

properties.name: action
properties.description:
If set, a synchronous POST call will be fired to the path defined.
The `login` event is also dispatched, so `event.preventDefault()` can be called to prevent the POST call.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description:
If set, disable the "Log in" button and prevent user from submitting login form.
It is re-enabled automatically, when error is set to true, allowing form resubmission
after user makes changes.

properties.name: error
properties.description:
If set, the error message is shown. The message is hidden by default.
When set, it changes the disabled state of the submit button.

properties.name: noForgotPassword
properties.description: Whether to hide the forgot password button. The button is visible by default.

properties.name: i18n
properties.defaultValue: {"form":{"title":"Log in","username":"Username","password":"Password","submit":"Log in","forgotPassword":"Forgot password"},"errorMessage":{"title":"Incorrect username or password","message":"Check that you have entered the correct username and password and try again."}}

properties.name: _preventAutoEnable
properties.description: If set, prevents auto enabling the component when error property is set to true.

properties.name: theme
properties.description:
Defines the theme of the element.
The value is propagated to vaadin-login-form-wrapper element.

elements.description:
`<vaadin-login-overlay-wrapper>` is a helper element for `<vaadin-login-overlay>` that provides
responsive template for the login form.

### Styling

The following Shadow DOM parts of the `<vaadin-login-overlay-wrapper>` are available for styling:

Part name       | Description
----------------|---------------------------------------------------------|
`card`          | Container for the entire component's content
`brand`         | Container for application title and description
`form`          | Container for the `<vaadin-login-form>` component

See [ThemableMixin â€“ how to apply styles for shadow parts](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-themable-mixin/wiki)

### Component's slots

The following slots are available for being set

Slot name    | Description
-------------|-----------------------------------------------|
no name      | Default placeholder for the `<vaadin-login-form>`
`title`      | Placeholder for customizing the title

See the usage example in `<vaadin-login-overlay>`.

properties.name: _last
properties.description: returns true if this is the last one in the opened overlays stack

properties.name: owner
properties.description: Owner element passed with renderer function

properties.name: renderer
properties.description:
Custom function for rendering the content of the overlay.
Receives three arguments:

- `root` The root container DOM element. Append your content to it.
- `owner` The host element of the renderer function.
- `model` The object with the properties related with rendering.

properties.name: template
properties.description: The template of the overlay content.

properties.name: instanceProps
properties.description: Optional argument for `Polymer.Templatize.templatize`.

properties.name: content
properties.description: References the content container after the template is stamped.

properties.name: model
properties.description: Object with properties that is passed to `renderer` function

properties.name: modeless
properties.description:
When true the overlay won't disable the main content, showing
it doesnâ€™t change the functionality of the user interface.

properties.name: hidden
properties.description:
When set to true, the overlay is hidden. This also closes the overlay
immediately in case there is a closing animation in progress.

properties.name: focusTrap
properties.description:
When true move focus to the first focusable element in the overlay,
or to the overlay if there are no focusable elements.

properties.name: restoreFocusOnClose
properties.description: Set to true to enable restoring of focus when overlay is closed.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title of the application.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Application description. Displayed under the title.

methods.name: _outsideClickListener
methods.description:
We need to listen on 'click' / 'tap' event and capture it and close the overlay before
propagating the event to the listener in the button. Otherwise, if the clicked button would call
open(), this would happen: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z86V_ICUCD4

elements.name: Vaadin.LoginOverlayWrapperElement

attributes.name: owner
attributes.description: Owner element passed with renderer function

attributes.name: renderer
attributes.description:
Custom function for rendering the content of the overlay.
Receives three arguments:

- `root` The root container DOM element. Append your content to it.
- `owner` The host element of the renderer function.
- `model` The object with the properties related with rendering.

attributes.name: template
attributes.description: The template of the overlay content.

attributes.name: instance-props
attributes.description: Optional argument for `Polymer.Templatize.templatize`.

attributes.name: content
attributes.description: References the content container after the template is stamped.

attributes.name: model
attributes.description: Object with properties that is passed to `renderer` function

attributes.name: modeless
attributes.description:
When true the overlay won't disable the main content, showing
it doesnâ€™t change the functionality of the user interface.

attributes.name: hidden
attributes.description:
When set to true, the overlay is hidden. This also closes the overlay
immediately in case there is a closing animation in progress.

attributes.name: focus-trap
attributes.description:
When true move focus to the first focusable element in the overlay,
or to the overlay if there are no focusable elements.

attributes.name: restore-focus-on-close
attributes.description: Set to true to enable restoring of focus when overlay is closed.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Title of the application.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Application description. Displayed under the title.

events.name: vaadin-overlay-close
events.description:
vaadin-overlay-close
fired before the `vaadin-overlay` will be closed. If canceled the closing of the overlay is canceled as well.

events.name: vaadin-overlay-escape-press
events.description:
vaadin-overlay-escape-press
fired before the `vaadin-overlay` will be closed on ESC button press. If canceled the closing of the overlay is canceled as well.

events.name: vaadin-overlay-open
events.description:
vaadin-overlay-open
fired after the `vaadin-overlay` is opened.

events.name: vaadin-overlay-outside-click
events.description:
We need to listen on 'click' / 'tap' event and capture it and close the overlay before
propagating the event to the listener in the button. Otherwise, if the clicked button would call
open(), this would happen: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z86V_ICUCD4

elements.description:
`<vaadin-login-overlay>` is a wrapper of the `<vaadin-login-form>` which opens a login form in an overlay and
having an additional `brand` part for application title and description. Using `<vaadin-login-overlay>` allows
password managers to work with login form.

```
<vaadin-login-overlay opened></vaadin-login-overlay>
```

### Styling

To style the element check: [`<vaadin-login-overlay-wrapper>`](#/elements/vaadin-login-overlay-wrapper),
[`<vaadin-login-form-wrapper>`](#/elements/vaadin-login-form-wrapper), [`<vaadin-login-form>`](#/elements/vaadin-login-form)
and `<vaadin-overlay>` elements

properties.name: title

properties.name: theme
properties.description:
Defines the theme of the element.
The value is propagated to vaadin-login-overlay-wrapper element.
